result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Merritt Means was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Fine of $1,800.00 plus DNA surcharge and all other coss, surcharges and supevision fees.  To be taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms, and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant's pro se petition for half-priced ignition interlock.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (23 pages) commencing JUNE 3, 2014 received and filed.
/from WCS dated 5/21/14, filed.

Attorney Dennis P Coffey in court, defendant Martin Means not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to lateness of the hour and scheduling conflict with defense counsel for the afternoon, case is adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Martin Means in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Martin Means in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms, and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.   Defense counsel's request for an adjournment of the sentencing was granted by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
$4,000.00 bail remains on deposit; defendant must post an additional $4,000.00 cash bail.  Court ordered TOT to Justice Point:  no alcohol or illegal substances; no weapons or firearms.

Attorney Dennis P Coffey in court, defendant Martin Means not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Defendant was remanded due to bail violation.  Arguments heard.  Court set bail at $8,000.00; defendant must post an additional $4,000.00.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.
No appearances.  Case adjourned to previously set plea date in Branch 20 on 4-22-2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Martin Means in court.  James W Frisch appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attempts to contact defense counsel were made by the court. Court admonished the defendant.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 20.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Mr. Coffey's office made aware of next court date.
Violation Report, received and filed
/from Justice Point, filed. rn

Defendant Martin Means in court with attorney Dennis P. Coffey.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State just received and turned over blood test results.  Defense counsel requested another date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martin Means in court with attorney Dennis P. Coffey.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has recently received discovery. Both parties are still waiting for a lab report to come in. Parties request adjourned scheduling date. Court ordered all conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Martin Means in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Hanna Kolberg for James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO DA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 2/17/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Martin Means in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Martin Means in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
AODA Assessment Form placed in Court File.
